reviews.text: This is the real deal -- a working farm with passionate owners who take great care of their guests. I've stayed at a number of agriturismi in Italy over the years, and this one is one of the two best (along with Il Frantoio in Puglia) from that group. The farm is huge; 300 hectares (>1 square mile), tended by Sebastiano, his son Matteo, and two sheep-herders. It was probably the quietest place we've been to in years -- the only sounds you hear are the bells on the sheep, the crickets, and the other guests.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay at a real working farm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The accommodations were very good; nice beds, up-to-date, clean, and comfortable. The food was outstanding -- everything except the apples and oranges for dessert came from the farm. Dinner is served family style, with excellent Sardinian homemade meats, cheeses and pasta.
reviews.title: An incredible place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reservations can be a challenge because of the language barrier, but I was successful using Google Translate to email them in Italian. Note also that they don't accept credit cards, so bring enough cash.
reviews.title: The highlight of Sardinia!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a terrific stay and can't wait to go back for a longer one!
reviews.title: Away from everything, near to your heart

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed 1 night early April 2013 but wished we would have stayed more. The place is so quiet that you can only relax there.
reviews.title: Lulled to sleep by cowbells
